intro: Nuttallia brandegeei, commonly known as the Brandegge's nuttallia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils. Nuttallia brandegeei is known for its resilience to drought and its ability to thrive in harsh desert conditions.
